descripcion:
Mr. Calaf has extensive experience in tax consultancy and planning, having participated in many corporate and family-business-group restructurings, as well as in merger processes and stock acquisitions.

He also ample experience in advising large Spanish business groups (consolidated tax regime), and multinational groups, as well as in advising on planning processes related to restructuring and selling business groups.

He is an expert in family protocols and agreements, and in the inheritance planning of business assets.
CV:
Mr. Calaf is a lecturer at the Family Business Department of the Universitat de Barcelona, in addition to lecturing in the Master in Family Businesses at the School of Business Administration (Escuela de Administración de Empresas or “EAE”), in the course Consejeros de Empresa Familiar (Family Business Advisers) at the Barcelona Chamber of Commerce, and in other master programs. He also lectures regularly at conferences and seminars on family businesses, and participates in training activities at the Associació Catalana de l'Empresa Familiar.

He is co-editor-in-chief of the books Comentarios al impuesto sobre la renta de las personas físicas (Comments on Personal Income Tax), Thomson-Aranzadi, and El buen gobierno de la empresa familiar (The Good Governance of Family Businesses), Aranzadi, and coordinator and promoter of the Decálogo de la Empresa Familiar (The Family Business Decalogue) published by Cuatrecasas.

Incidencia del Reglamento General de las actuaciones y los procedimientos de gestión e inspección tributaria, aprobado por Real decreto 1065/2007, en la duración del procedimiento inspector. Revista de contabilidad y tributación, nº 298.

La duración del procedimiento inspector, na obra colectiva La inspección de Hacienda en el reglamento general de aplicación de los tributos, publicada pelo Instituto de Estudios Fiscales.

IVA: transmisión de la totalidad del patrimonio empresarial y operaciones de fusión y escisión. Tribuna Fiscal: Revista Tributaria y Financiera, nº 195, de 1 de Janeiro de 2007.

El ‘fraude carrusel’ en el IVA. Tribuna Fiscal: Revista Tributaria y Financiera, nº 48, 1 de Junho de 2007. Editor: CISS, S.A.

descripcion:
Mr. de Vicente has ample experience in defending the interests of taxpayers before the administrative and justice courts of all levels.

He specializes in tax proceedings and criminal proceedings related to offenses against the tax authorities.

He is a state tax inspector (on leave of absence) and a member of the High Body of Auditors of the Court of Auditors (on leave of absence).
CV:
Mr. de Vicente lectures on tax procedures and judicial review procedures at the IE and in the Master for Admission to the Practice of Law at the Universidad de Navarra (Madrid).

He has written several articles on tax proceedings, such as:

Incidencia del Reglamento General de las actuaciones y los procedimientos de gestión e inspección tributaria, aprobado por Real decreto 1065/2007, en la duración del procedimiento inspector (The effects of the General Regulations of the actions and procedures for inspecting and managing tax, approved by Royal Decree 1065/2007, on the duration of inspection proceedings), in the accounting and tax journal Revista de contabilidad y tributación, no. 298.

La duración del procedimiento inspector (The Duration of Inspection Proceedings), in the collective work La inspección de Hacienda en el reglamento general de aplicación de los tributos (The Inspection by the Tax Authorities in the General Regulations on Tax Application), Instituto de Estudios Fiscales.

IVA: transmisión de la totalidad del patrimonio empresarial y operaciones de fusión y escisión (VAT: business asset transfers, and merger and spin-off transactions), in the tax and financial journal Tribuna Fiscal: Revista Tributaria y Financiera, no. 195, January 1, 2007.

El ‘fraude carrusel’ en el IVA (“Carousel fraud” of VAT) in the tax and financial journal Tribuna Fiscal: Revista Tributaria y Financiera, no. 48, June 1, 2007, published by CISS, S.A.

Member of the Madrid Bar Association.

descripcion:
Es asesor habitual de las Administraciones Públicas del ámbito nacional y comunitario y ha cultivado el derecho administrativo comparado y europeo; la política regulatoria y los nuevos métodos o modos de regulación y gobernanza y su impacto sobre el nuevo derecho administrativo, en perspectiva europea y norteamericana.

Miembro de los grupos internacionales de estudio sobre la Reforma del Derecho Administrativo, en Alemania, y sobre el Derecho Administrativo Global, en EE.UU. Director del Centro de Derecho Administrativo y Reforma Regulatoria, que aglutina a universidades, think-tanks y expertos de diversas especialidades y países.

Ha sido Letrado del Tribunal Constitucional (1994-1998) y Consejero del Consejo Consultivo de Andalucía (2002-2006).
CV:
Javier Barnes es catedrático de Derecho Administrativo en la Universidad de Huelva, y actualmente además es profesor visitante de las Universidades de Nueva York (NYU), Heidelberg (Universität Heidelberg) y Trento (Università degli Studi di Trento).

Ha publicado estudios en diversos países en materias de su especialidad (el procedimiento administrativo y la justicia en el panorama comparado; propiedad y responsabilidad; la sociedad de la información y la Administración Pública o el principio de proporcionalidad). Entre los últimos estudios, pueden citarse las obras colectivas Innovación y reforma en el derecho administrativo (2006) y La transformación del procedimiento administrativo (2008), publicadas por la Editorial Derecho Global – Global Law Press, un proyecto académico internacional que también dirige (http://www.globallawpress.org/introduccion.htm), y Towards a Third Generation of Administrative Procedure (Hacia un procedimiento administrativo de tercera generación) (Yale University Press, 2010).

Publicou estudos em diversos países sobre matérias da sua especialidade (o procedimento administrativo e a justiça no panorama comparado; propriedade e responsabilidade; a sociedade da informação e a Administração Pública ou o princípio da proporcionalidade). Entre os seus últimos estudos, encontram-se as obras colectivas “Innovación y reformaenel derecho administrativo” (2006) e “La transformación del procedimiento administrativo"" (2008), publicadas pela Editorial Derecho Global – Global Law Press, um projecto académico internacional que também dirige (http://www.globallawpress.org/introduccion.htm), e “Towards a Third Generation of Administrative Procedure” (Yale University Press, 2010).

descripcion:
A regular advisor to Spanish and European Union public administrations, he specializes in comparative and European administrative law, as well as in regulatory policies and the new regulatory and governance methods, and their effects on new administrative law, both from a European and American perspective. 

Mr. Barnes is a member of international study groups, on the reform of administrative law, in Germany, and on global administrative law, in the US. He is head of the Center for Administrative Law and Regulatory Reform (Centro de Derecho Administrativo y Reforma Regulatoria), that brings together universities, think tanks and experts from a wide range of fields and countries.

He was advisor to the Constitutional Court from 1994 to 1998, and a member of the Advisory Board of Andalusia from 2002 to 2006.
CV:
Javier Barnes is a professor of administrative law at the University of Huelva and a visiting lecturer at universities in New York (New York University), Heidelberg (Universität Heidelberg) and Trento (Università degli Studi di Trento).

He has published studies in several countries in his area of specialty (the administrative procedure and justice in a compared panorama; property and liability; the information society and the public administration or the principle of proportionality). Some of his recent studies include the collective works Innovación y reforma en el derecho administrative (Innovation and Reform in Administrative Law), 2006, and La transformación del procedimiento administrative (The Transformation of the Administrative Procedure), Derecho Global – Global Law Press, 2008. Derecho Global – Global Law Press is an international academic project that also manages the website http://www.globallawpress.org/introduccion.htm; and Towards a Third Generation of Administrative Procedure, Yale University Press, 2010.

descripcion: Actualmente se encuentra en excedencia, ocupando el cargo de senior counsel de la Unidad de Insolvencia y Derechos de los Acreedores del Banco Mundial. Especialista en Derecho Mercantil y, en concreto, en las áreas de Derecho de Sociedades, Derecho del Mercado de Valores y Derecho Concursal. José Mª Garrido es Catedrático de Derecho Mercantil de la Universidad de Castilla-La Mancha. Es asimismo autor de numerosos libros y artículos sobre Derecho Mercantil, publicados en España, Italia y Reino Unido.
CV:
Reconocido especialista en el ámbito del gobierno corporativo, formó parte del Grupo de Expertos de Alto Nivel en Derecho de Sociedades de la Unión Europea (""Grupo Winter""), fue Secretario de la Comisión Especial para el Fomento de la Transparencia y la Seguridad en los Mercados Financieros (""Comisión Aldama""), y miembro de la Comisión para la elaboración del Código Unificado de Buen Gobierno. Ha sido Secretario del Consejo de la Comisión Nacional del Mercado de Valores, y Director General del Servicio Jurídico de la CNMV (2001-2005), así como miembro de la Comisión para la Prevención del Blanqueo de Capitales. Actualmente es miembro del Foro Europeo de Gobierno Corporativo, y miembro del European Corporate Governance Institute.

Colegio de Abogados de Madrid

Especialista em Direito Comercial e, concretamente, nas áreas de Direito das Sociedades, Direito do Mercado de Valores e Direito de Falências. José Mª Garrido é Catedrático de Direito Comercial da Universidade de Castilla-La Mancha. É, além disso, autor de inúmeros livros e artigos sobre Direito Comercial, publicados em Espanha, Itália e Reino Unido.
CV: Reconhecido especialista no âmbito da gestão empresarial, fez parte do Grupo de Especialistas de Alto Nível em Direito das Sociedades da União Europeia (""Grupo Winter""), foi Secretário da Comissão Especial para o Fomento da Transparência e da Segurança nos Mercados Financeiros (""Comissão Aldama"") e membro da Comissão para a elaboração do Código Unificado de Boa Gestão. Foi Secretário do Conselho da Comissão Nacional do Mercado de Valores, e Director Geral do Serviço Jurídico da CNMV (2001-2005), bem como membro da Comissão para a Prevenção do Branqueamento de Capitais. Actualmente é membro do Fórum Europeu de Gestão Empresarial e membro do European Corporate Governance Institute.

descripcion: Currently on leave of absence, Mr. José Mª Garrido is senior counsel of the Insolvency and Creditor Rights unit of the World Bank. Mr. Garrido is a specialist in corporate law, particularly in company law, securities-market law and bankruptcy law. He is a professor of corporate law at Universidad de Castilla-La Mancha and has written several books and articles on this topic, published in Italy, Spain and the United Kingdom.
CV: A renowned specialist in corporate governance, he formed part of the European Union’s High Level Group of Experts in Company Law (“Winter Group”), was secretary of the special committee to promote transparency and security on financial markets (“Aldama Committee""), and a member of the committee that drafted the Unified Code of Good Governance. He was council secretary of the Spanish Stock Market Regulator (Comisión Nacional del Mercado de Valores-CNMV) and managing director of its legal department from 2001 to 2005. He was also a member of the Committee for the Prevention of Money-Laundering. Currently, he is a member of the European Corporate Governance Forum and of the European Corporate Governance Institute.Member of the Madrid Bar Association

descripcion:
Magistrado en excedencia (Nº 1 de su promoción), con experiencia en todas las jurisdicciones, David Velázquez fue el Magistrado más votado de Cataluña en las últimas elecciones a la Sala de Gobierno del Tribunal Superior de Justicia, de la que ha formado parte durante 7 años.

Con amplia experiencia internacional derivada de la participación en proyectos judiciales internacionales, ha asumido igualmente como abogado la dirección de Leading Cases en Derecho Penal Económico, con relevantes clientes multinacionales.

Es miembro del German Desk de Cuatrecasas.

David Velázquez es en la actualidad Profesor asociado de Derecho Penal de la Universidad Pompeu Fabra y Profesor Colaborador de Procesal  y miembro del Equipo Académico del Instituto de Probática de la Universidad Ramon Llull-ESADE de Barcelona.

Ha formado parte como Magistrado del Grupo de Expertos Internacionales del CGPJ y de las Comisiones de Relaciones de la Sala de Gobierno del TSJ de Cataluña. Experto en Derecho Penal Económico y autor de numerosas publicaciones, imparte igualmente las asignaturas de Litigación  Penal y Prueba en el Master de la Abogacía de la Universidad Pompeu Fabra de Barcelona.

Com ampla experiência internacional, resultante da participação em projectos judiciais internacionais, assumiu igualmente, enquanto advogado, a direcção de Leading Cases em Direito Penal Económico, com clientes multinacionais de relevo.

descripcion:
A judge (who came top of his class at the Judicial School) on leave of absence with experience in all courts, David Velázquez was the most voted judge from Catalonia in the last elections to the Governing Body of the High Court of Justice, where he worked for seven years.

He has extensive international experience, having worked on international judicial matters and, as a lawyer, he has supervised many leading cases in economic criminal law involving important multinational clients.

Mr. Velázquez is member of Cuatrecasas’s German Desk.
CV:
In addition to being an associate lecturer of criminal law at the Universidad Pompeu Fabra in Barcelona, Mr. Velázquez is a collaborating lecturer of procedural law and a member of the academic team at the Instituto de Probática of the Universidad Ramon Llull-ESADE in Barcelona.

He has, as a judge, formed part of the Group of International Experts of the General Council of the Spanish Judiciary and of the relations committees of the Governing Body of the High Court of Justice of Catalonia. An expert on economic criminal law and the author of several publications, he also lectures on “criminal litigation” and “evidence” in the Master in Legal Practice at the Universidad Pompeu Fabra.

descripcion: A partner at Cuatrecasas since 1988, Mr. Laorden has advised on many corporate acquisitions and consolidations, the legal planning and corporate organization of family businesses, as well as on foreign investments in Spain and Spanish investment abroad. CV:

He lectures at the School of Legal Practice of the Universidad Pontificia de Comillas ICADE and frequently lectures for organizations specialized in taxation. He has published several articles on tax law and has advised business associations on drafting and proposing legislative modifications in different areas. 

A member of the Madrid Bar Association, Mr. Laorden is also a member of the board of trustees of Fundación para la Protección de Personas con Minusvalía (Foundation for People with Disabilities) and chairman of the advisory board of Fundación ANESVAD. He is a founding member of the Hispanic-Moroccan Jurist Forum and a member of the National Advisory Committee (Honors Committee) of the journal Educación y Derecho.
